articles.headline: Cardiologists Question Delay of Data on 2 Drugs
articles.snippet: A delay in publishing the results of trials on cholesterol  drugs is raising questions for the drug industry.
articles.abstract: A delay in publishing the results of trials on cholesterol  drugs is raising questions for the drug industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: Prescriptions for the cholesterol-lowering drugs Zetia and Vytorin are written for almost 800,000 Americans every week, at a cost this year of about $4 billion. Yet it still is not clear how well the drugs work.

articles.headline: Travelers’ Odds Decline on Airline Baggage
articles.snippet: Despite increased efforts by the airlines, millions of travelers’ bags still fail to reach the carousel.
articles.abstract: Despite increased efforts by the airlines, millions of travelers’ bags still fail to reach the carousel.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — Why do so many passengers get off the plane only to discover that their baggage did not make the trip with them?

articles.headline: Loan Crisis Entangles Freddie Mac
articles.snippet: Losses at the big mortgage finance company on Tuesday underscored the continuing turmoil in the housing industry.
articles.abstract: Losses at the big mortgage finance company on Tuesday underscored the continuing turmoil in the housing industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: Losses at Freddie Mac underscored the continuing turmoil in the housing industry yesterday, and other developments reinforced the sense that conditions would not improve soon.

articles.headline: For Edwards, a Marriage Made in Politics That Never Quite Fit
articles.snippet: John Kerry and John Edwards, running mates but never really friends, ended 2004 in recrimination and regrets.
articles.abstract: John Kerry and John Edwards, running mates but never really friends, ended 2004 in recrimination and regrets.
articles.lead_paragraph: John Edwards, accepting his party’s nomination for vice president, roused a cheering crowd at the 2004 Democratic convention with the kind of buoyant refrain that had become his trademark: “Hope is on the way.”

articles.headline: Khmer Rouge Figure Appears in Court
articles.snippet: A man who once commanded an efficient and ruthless torture house entered a court to answer for his crimes.
articles.abstract: A man who once commanded an efficient and ruthless torture house entered a court to answer for his crimes.
articles.lead_paragraph: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Nov. 20 — More than 28 years after the killing stopped, the first Khmer Rouge defendant stepped into a public courtroom on Tuesday to answer for the deaths of 1.7 million people — a tiny, self-effacing man who once commanded an efficient and ruthless torture house.

articles.headline: Instead of Fighting Ad Leaks, Some Retailers Embrace Them
articles.snippet:
An unlikely alliance between stores and Web sites that prematurely leak copies of discount-filled advertisements indicates how worried retailers are about the holiday shopping season.

But it turns out that a big source of the leaks are the retail...
articles.abstract:
An unlikely alliance between stores and Web sites that prematurely leak copies of discount-filled advertisements indicates how worried retailers are about the holiday shopping season.

But it turns out that a big source of the leaks are the retailers themselves.
articles.lead_paragraph: Every year, retailers denounce the renegade Web sites that prematurely disclose leaked copies of discount-filled advertisements for the day after Thanksgiving.

articles.headline: Hollywood and Strikers Watch Clock
articles.snippet: Sixteen days into a work stoppage, screenwriters and their employers are scheduled to talk on Monday for the first time since Nov. 4.
articles.abstract: Sixteen days into a work stoppage, screenwriters and their employers are scheduled to talk on Monday for the first time since Nov. 4.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 20 — Sun Tzu, the Chinese sage, warned of the danger in prolonged conflict. “Let your great object be victory, not lengthy campaigns,” he wrote in “The Art of War.”
articles.byline: By Michael Cieply and Brooks Barnes

articles.headline: Justices to Decide on Right to Keep Handgun
articles.snippet: The Supreme Court is plunging into a debate over how to interpret the Second Amendment’s guarantee of the “right of the people to keep and bear arms.”
articles.abstract: The Supreme Court is plunging into a debate over how to interpret the Second Amendment’s guarantee of the “right of the people to keep and bear arms.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 — The Supreme Court announced Tuesday that it would decide whether the Constitution grants individuals the right to keep guns in their homes for private use, plunging the justices headlong into a divisive and long-running debate over how to interpret the Second Amendment’s guarantee of the “right of the people to keep and bear arms.”

articles.headline: Fed Expects Slowdown to Deepen
articles.snippet: The Federal Reserve expects economic growth to slow sharply next year, and policy makers there are worried that even this forecast may prove too optimistic.
articles.abstract: The Federal Reserve expects economic growth to slow sharply next year, and policy makers there are worried that even this forecast may prove too optimistic.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 — The Federal Reserve expects economic growth to slow sharply next year, and policy makers there are worried that even this forecast may prove too optimistic, according to an assessment that the central bank released on Tuesday.
